item.title: Eric add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "1. When a distinguished but elderly scientist states that something is possible, he is almost certainly right. When he states that something is impossible, he is very probably wrong. 2. The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible. 3. Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Eric add a quote by paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's
item.description: "Sure, 90% of science fiction is crud. That's because 90% of everything is crud." -- paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's

item.title: Eric add a quote by James P. Blaylock
item.description: "He’d given up squid merchanting when he’d found that the creatures inhabited his dreams, all leggy and cold." -- James P. Blaylock
